P-4 P413 Nissan Skyline GT-R (R34) 2003 JGTC Series GT500 Class 3rd Place M. Kageyama/R. Lyons




2003 was the 5th - and final - season for the R34 GT-R in the JGTC series. The R34 took the GT500 Class title in its debut season in 1999 but was not able to secure a second title after that. With the Fiarlady Z set to replace the it, there was a big push to secure a second title for the R34. To help secure that second title Nissan made improvements to the car in the off-season and paired experience with youth on the 3 teams. In the #22 car, 1998 JGTC champion Masami Kageyama was paired with up-and-coming driver Richard Lyons.

Kageyama & Lyons scored the R34â€™s first win for the season in Round 2 at Fuji speedway. This was the only win for them and they went on to finish the season 3rd in class overall. As for the R34 it finished the season with 3 wins, tied with the Toyota Supra for most wins.

The model seen below is not from any specific race but as far as I can tell from photos seems to be closest to the Round 2-winning version of the car.
